newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Sterlite shuts copper smelter.
newsitem.headline: India's Sterlite shuts copper smelter.

text.p: India's Sterlite Industries Ltd on Wednesday said it was ordered to shut operations at its southern copper smelter on July 6 by the Tamil Nadu state government investigating a gas leak incident.
"We have been ordered to close down our smelting activities by the government authorities ... and we have promptly complied with the same," the company said in a statement.
The plant is located in the southern Tamil Nadu state. The company earlier this week denied newpaper reports of a gas leakage at the plant.

"It is unfortunate that the responsibility for the accident, involving 100 workers in another factory (who were taken ill), has been placed squarely on the shoulders of our industry, without carrying out a thorough investigation," it said.
Newspapers on Monday said Sterlite's smelter was asked to close down on the weekend following a gas leak.
"There was no leakage of any kind from our plant and none of the people working at our unit has been affected," it said.
Sterlite's 100,000 tonnes a year copper smelter started operations in December 1996.
"We would like to add that nowhere in the world has any kind of environmental disaster been known to occur due to gaseous emissions from a copper smelter," the firm said.
"The findings of (our) internal committee clearly show that our plant conditions were totally normal during the period of the accident next door," it said.
The statement said that state authorities were conducting its own investigation into the leak and "we are fully confident that their findings will endorse our point of view".

"The SO2 (sulphur dioxide) monitoring devices in all our chimneys were fully operational and the recorded data clearly indicates that the emission levels were well within the stipulated norms," the company said.
The closure of the plant affected the firm's share prices.
Sterlite shares were quoted 5.75 rupees lower at 243 rupees on the Bombay Stock Exchange on Wednesday.
